talk.author: did:plc:cfqmp5vnakk4nh45z2agt5e5
talk.utter:
Be careful referring to human population as a driver for emissions. This can be interpreted as ‘India/Nigeria’s birth rates are the problem’. 

It is much more a problem of growing consumption of the rich minority (most of the UK) due to capitalism as you say in the second part.

talk.author: did:plc:dupirzvlby7azzkrbke3qtmm
talk.utter: I know it can be interpreted wrongly but it's equally wrong, I feel, to brush it under the carpet, potentially feeding the far-right narratives of pronatalism and eugenism. It's not just population but the increase in middle class consumption levels, as well as the rich minority

talk.author: did:plc:dupirzvlby7azzkrbke3qtmm
talk.utter: It's also not just about CO2, not just about f fuels. For instance methane levels are growing faster than CO2 and top single anthropogenic cause is still meat/dairy consumption. Methane is causing more warming than CO2 over a decade or so. Forest are disappearing, oceans warming & acidifying etc

talk.author: did:plc:cfqmp5vnakk4nh45z2agt5e5
talk.utter:
Absolutely, and it’s important we recognise meat/dairy consumption is not directly correlated to population growth, but rather the capitalism that drives it.

Far right narratives often refer to overpopulation, it shifts the blame.

Obviously, limitless population is nuts but avoid leading with that
